page.title: 14St.Mary's Church,Carlton.
page.content: An ancient chapel attached to the vicarage of Norwell was taken down in 1850 and a new church erected. It was dedicated in 1851.The Church spire is a dominating feature of the flat river valley landscape. The present vicar lives at Sutton. The old school,now closed, is used for village functions. Many social events are organised by the church and many joint activities take place with Sutton Church. In the Church is an old Saxon font shaped like a vase.It was found in a garden in Carlton in 1825. Legend has it that Dick Turpin stopped at the blacksmith's shop, not far from the Church,to have his horse shod in reverse to deceive his pursuers.
